com.thelastcheck.commons.buffer

Class ByteArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thelastcheck.commons.buffer.ByteArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class ByteArray
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable
    This is a helper class for storing and retrieving data from a byte array.
    Version:
    $Date: 2011/05/23 01:48:18 $ $Revision: 1.6 $
    Author:
    Jerry Bowman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteArray(byte[] array)
      Create a new ByteArray backed by the specified array with default encoding of ASCII and byte order of BIG_ENDIAN.
      ByteArray(byte[] array, ByteOrder order)
      Create a new ByteArray backed by the specified array with default encoding of ASCII and the specified byte order.

      Create a new ByteArray backed by the specified array with the specified encoding and byte order of BIG_ENDIAN.

      Create a new ByteArray backed by the specified array with the specified encoding and byte order.
      ByteArray(ByteArray byteArray)
      Creates a new ByteArray object that is backed by the same byte[] array value as the original.

      Create a new ByteArray backed by the specified ByteBuffer with the default encoding of ASCII and byte order of specified ByteBuffer.

      Create a new ByteArray backed by the specified ByteBuffer with the specified encoding and byte order of specified ByteBuffer.

      ByteArray(int size, String encoding, ByteOrder order)
      Create a new ByteArray of the specified size with specified encoding and specified byte order.

      Places the filler space byte in every position in the byte array.

      Places the byte in every position in the byte array.

      Places the byte in every position in the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified.

      This will return the underlying byte array for this object.
      ByteBuffer getBuffer()
      This returns a new ByteBuffer with the same backing array used by this object.

      Deprecated. 
      as of version 1.7, replaced by getBytes(), now replaced by #getArray().value.
      byte[] getBytes()
      This will return a copy of the contents of the array in this object.

      This returns the encoding scheme to be used in setting and getting string data from the byte array.

      This returns the byte order to be used in setting and getting binary numeric data from the byte array.

      Returns a space value for the encoding specified.

      Tells whether or not this buffer is backed by an accessible byte array.

      This sets the encoding scheme to be used in setting and getting string data from the byte array.
      ByteArray setOrder(ByteOrder order)
      This sets the byte order to be used in setting and getting binary, numeric data (short, int, long, float, double) from the byte array.

      Creates a new ByteArray backed by the same buffer, but with a different slice or view of the data based on the specified displacement and length into this ByteArray.

      Returns a boolean value indicating if all of the bits in the mask are currently set to 1.

      Converts String object to byte array.
      ByteArray write(byte[] bytes, int displacement)
      Places the contents of the from byte array into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length of the from byte array.
      ByteArray write(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length, int displacement)
      Places the contents of the from byte array into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified.
      ByteArray write(ByteArray byteArray, int displacement)
      Places the contents of the fromteh ByteArray into the byte array at the displacement specified for the size of the ByteArray specified.
      ByteArray write(ByteArray byteArray, int displacement, int length)
      Places the contents of the from ByteArray into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified.
      ByteArray write(byte b, int displacement)
      Places the value of the byte into the byte array at the displacement specified.

      Stores a char array into the ByteArray starting at the specified displacement.

      Places the contents of the from char array into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified.

      Places the value of the char into the byte array at the displacement specified.

      Places the value of the long into the byte array at the displacement specified.

      Places the value of the short into the byte array at the displacement specified.
      ByteArray write(String s, int displacement)
      Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified using the encoding scheme for this byte array.
      ByteArray write(String s, int displacement, int length)
      Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified using the encoding scheme for this array.
      ByteArray write(String s, int displacement, int length, boolean nts)
      Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified using the specified encoding scheme.
      ByteArray writeAsPns(String s, int displacement, int length)
      Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified as a packed-no-sign field value.
      ByteArray writeAsPns(String s, int displacement, int length, char filler)
      Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified as a packed-no-sign field value.
      ByteArray writeAsPs(String s, int displacement, int length)
      Validate the input string first (it allows only numbers and + or - character) and then call writeByteArrayAsPns.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(ByteArray byteArray)
        Creates a new ByteArray object that is backed by the same byte[] array value as the original. Calling methods on either the original or this new instance will produce exactly the same results to the same underlying array of bytes. Note this is different from clone() which create a complete new copy of the object including a new underlying byte[] array.
        Parameters:
        byteArray -

      • testBit

        public boolean testBit(int displacement,
              byte mask)
        Returns a boolean value indicating if all of the bits in the mask are currently set to 1. If any of the bits in the mask are not set in the specified byte, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        mask - A bit mask to test
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the mask bits are set
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • setBit

        public ByteArray setBit(int displacement,
               byte mask,
               boolean b)

        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        mask - A bit mask to set
        b - A boolean indicate if the mask bits should be set or cleared.
        Returns:
        this ByteArray

        public byte[] read(int displacement,

      • read

        public int read(int displacement,
       byte[] bytes)
        Fills a byte array from the ByteArray starting at the specified displacement. An invocation of this method of the form ba.read(ba, disp) behaves in exactly the same was as the invocation 
         ba.read(ba, 0, ba.length, disp);
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        bytess - The byte array to be filled
        Returns:
        An int containing the number of bytes actually stored. This could be less than the size of the byte array if the available bytes in the byte array is less than is available from the current displacement.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        read(int, byte[], int, int)

      • read

        public int read(int displacement,
       byte[] bytes,
       int offset,
       int length)
        Fills a byte array at the specified offset in the byte array for the length specified from the ByteArray starting at the specified displacement.
        Parameters:

        bytes - The byte array to be filled
        offset - The offset in the byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the bytes to be copied
        Returns:
        An int containing the number of bytes actually stored. This could be less than the requested value if the available bytes in the byte array is less than is available from the current displacement.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • read

        public int read(int displacement,
       char[] chars)
        Fills a char array from the ByteArray starting at the specified displacement. An invocation of this method of the form ba.read(displacement, chars) behaves in exactly the same was as the invocation 
         ba.read(displacement, chars, 0, chars.length);
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        chars - The char array to be filled
        Returns:
        An int containing the number of chars actually stored. This could be less than the size of the char array if the available bytes in the byte array is less than is available from the current displacement.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        read(int, char[], int, int)

      • readAsString

        public String readAsString(int displacement,
                  int length,
                  boolean nts)
        Returns a new String derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement for the specified length. If nts (null terminated string) is true, then a check is made for a null-byte (binary zeroes). If a null byte is found in the buffer area being processed, all data after the null-byte (including the null-byte) will be ignored and only the text data preceding this null-byte will be stored in the newly created String.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        nts - The flag to indicate to use a null byte as the data terminator
        Returns:
        A String derived from the requested bytes.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readAsFloat

        public float readAsFloat(int displacement)
        Returns a new float derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement. IEEE Standard 754 floating point format is assumed for the byte array data. The number of bytes used to retrieve the float value from the byte array is 8.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        A float derived from the requested bytes.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readAsDouble

        public double readAsDouble(int displacement)
        Returns a new double derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement. IEEE Standard 754 floating point format is assumed for the byte array data. The number of bytes used to retrieve the double value from the byte array is 8.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        A double derived from the requested bytes.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readAsShort

        public short readAsShort(int displacement)
        Returns a new short derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement. The data bytes are assumed to be in big-endian format. The number of bytes used to retrieve the short value from the byte array is 2.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        A short derived from requested bytes.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readAsInt

        public int readAsInt(int displacement)
        Returns a new int derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement. The data bytes are assumed to be in big-endian format. The number of bytes used to retrieve the int value from the byte array is 4.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        An int derived from requested bytes.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readAsLong

        public long readAsLong(int displacement)
        Returns a new long derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement. The data bytes are assumed to be in big-endian format. The number of bytes used to retrieve the long value from the byte array is 8.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        An long derived from requested bytes.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readPns

        public String readPns(int displacement,
             int length)
        Returns a new String derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement for the specified length. The bytes are read from a packed-no-sign format. This treats each nybble in the array as either a digit from 0-9, or interprets 'A'-'F' as follows: 'A' means space, 'D' means dash, 'E' or 'F' means unknown or digit error. 'B' and 'C' are left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        Returns:
        A string containing the field from the buffer converted from a packed no sign field.

      • readPns

        public String readPns(int displacement,
             int length,
             boolean convertAtoF)
        Returns a new String derived from the contents of the byte array at the specified displacement for the specified length. The bytes are read from a packed-no-sign format. This treats each nybble in the array as either a digit from 0-9, or interprets 'A'-'F' as follows: 'A' means space, 'D' means dash, 'E' or 'F' means unknown or digit error. If the convertAtoF flag is true, then the values are converted to the actual character, i.e., 'A' to space, 'D' to dash, 'E' or 'F' to asterisk, and 'B' and 'C' are left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        convertAtoF - The flag to indicate the A-F character values should be converted.
        Returns:
        A string containing the field from the buffer converted from a packed no sign field.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

        public ByteArray fill()
        Places the filler space byte in every position in the byte array.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the current ByteArray

      • write

        public ByteArray write(char[] chars,
              int displacement)
        Stores a char array into the ByteArray starting at the specified displacement. An invocation of this method of the form ba.write(ca, disp) behaves in exactly the same was as the invocation 
         ba.write(ca, 0, ca.length, disp);
        Parameters:
        chars - The char array to be stored
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        read(int, char[], int, int)

      • write

        public ByteArray write(char[] chars,
              int offset,
              int length,
              int displacement)
        Places the contents of the from char array into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified.
        Parameters:

        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • write

        public ByteArray write(String s,
              int displacement)
        Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified using the encoding scheme for this byte array. Any space remaining in the byte array (String.length < length) will be filled with spaces using the ASCII encoding scheme.
        Parameters:
        s - The String value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        write(java.lang.String, int, int, boolean), ByteArray#write(java.lang.String, int, int, boolean, java.lang.String)

      • write

        public ByteArray write(String s,
              int displacement,
              int length)
        Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified using the encoding scheme for this array. Any space remaining in the byte array (String.length < length) will be filled with spaces using the ASCII encoding scheme.
        Parameters:
        s - The String value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        ByteArray#writeByteArray(byte[], java.lang.String, int, int, boolean), ByteArray#writeByteArray(byte[], java.lang.String, int, int, boolean, java.lang.String)

      • write

        public ByteArray write(String s,
              int displacement,
              int length,
              boolean nts)
        Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified using the specified encoding scheme. If nts (null terminated string) is true, then any space remaining in the byte array for the length specified (String.length < length) will be filled with nulls (binary zeros). If nts is false, then any extra bytes will be filled with spaces using the specified encoding scheme.
        Parameters:
        s - The String value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        nts - The flag to indicate to use a null byte as the data terminator
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        ByteArray#writeByteArray(byte[], java.lang.String, int, int), ByteArray#writeByteArray(byte[], java.lang.String, int, int, boolean)

      • write

        public ByteArray write(short s,
              int displacement)
        Places the value of the short into the byte array at the displacement specified. The short is stored as a big-endian value in the following 2 bytes from the displacement.
        Parameters:
        s - The short value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • writeAsPs

        public ByteArray writeAsPs(String s,
                  int displacement,
                  int length)
        Validate the input string first (it allows only numbers and + or - character) and then call writeByteArrayAsPns. It also adds a sign at the right (C for +, D for -, F for no sign).
        Parameters:
        s - The String value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • writeAsPns

        public ByteArray writeAsPns(String s,
                   int displacement,
                   int length)
        Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified as a packed-no-sign field value. Spaces will be converted to 'A', dashed to 'D', and asterisks to 'F'. If the String value will not fill the whole length of the area, it will be right-justified and space ('A') filled on the left.
        Parameters:
        s - The String value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray

      • writeAsPns

        public ByteArray writeAsPns(String s,
                   int displacement,
                   int length,
                   char filler)
        Places the contents of the String into the byte array at the displacement specified for the length specified as a packed-no-sign field value. Spaces will be converted to 'A', dashed to 'D', and asterisks to 'F'. If the String value will not fill the whole length of the area, it will be right-justified and space ('A') filled on the left.
        Parameters:
        s - The String value to place in this byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        filler - Character that is used to fill in the input value if it is too short
        Returns:
        the current ByteArray
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object anObject)
        Compares the value of all the corresponding bytes between this byte array and another. If the length of the arrays are the same and each corresponding byte value is the same, then the two arrays are considered equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        anObject - The ByteArray to compare to this one for an equal match
        Returns:
        true if all corresponding byte values are equal

      • equalTo

        public static boolean equalTo(ByteArray a,
              ByteArray b)
        Compares the value of all the corresponding bytes between byte array a and b. If the length of the arrays are the same and each corresponding byte value is the same, then the two arrays are considered equal.
        Parameters:
        a - The first ByteArray to compare
        b - The second ByteArray to compare
        Returns:
        true if all corresponding byte values are equal

      • equalSame

        public boolean equalSame(byte b)
        Compares the value of all the bytes in this byte array to the specified byte. If all of the values in the array are the same value as the specified byte, then true is returned.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte value to compare as a match to all bytes in the byte array
        Returns:
        true if all byte values are equal to value
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • equalSame

        public boolean equalSame(byte b,
                int displacement,
                int length)
        Compares the value of all the bytes in this byte array to the specified byte starting at displacement for length bytes. If all of the values in this array for the specified range are the same value as the specified byte, then true is returned.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte value to compare as a match to all bytes in the byte array
        displacement - The offset in this byte array, first byte is 0.
        length - The length of the field in the buffer.
        Returns:
        true if all byte values are equal to value
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        the length of this ByteArray

      • hasArray

        public boolean hasArray()
        Tells whether or not this buffer is backed by an accessible byte array.

        If this method returns true then the getArray() method may safely be invoked.

        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this ByteArray is backed by an array and is not read-only

      • getArray

        public ByteArray.UnderlyingArray getArray()
        This will return the underlying byte array for this object. Modifying this byte array will change the contents of the array in this object. However, if this array is not accessible, an exception is thrown. This array is not accessible from this method if the underlying ByteBuffer does not have an accessible array or is read only.
        Returns:
        a structure indicating the underlying array and it's current offset and length values.
        Throws:
        ReadOnlyBufferException - - If this buffer is backed by an array but is read-only
        UnsupportedOperationException - - If this buffer is not backed by an accessible array

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        This will return a copy of the contents of the array in this object.
        Returns:
        the array of bytes

      • getByteArray

        @Deprecated
public byte[] getByteArray()
        Deprecated. as of version 1.7, replaced by getBytes(), now replaced by #getArray().value.
        This will return the underlying byte array for this object. Modifying this byte array will change the contents of the array in this object.
        Returns:
        the array of bytes

      • setEncoding

        public ByteArray setEncoding(String encoding)
        This sets the encoding scheme to be used in setting and getting string data from the byte array. This should match the encoding type of the actual data. Setting this to an incorrect value will result in the string data be improperly interpreted when constructing a String object which is based on Unicode.
        Parameters:
        encoding -
        Returns:
        this ByteArray

      • getEncoding

        public String getEncoding()
        This returns the encoding scheme to be used in setting and getting string data from the byte array.
        Returns:
        encoding

      • setOrder

        public ByteArray setOrder(ByteOrder order)
        This sets the byte order to be used in setting and getting binary, numeric data (short, int, long, float, double) from the byte array. This should match the byte order of the actual data. Setting this to an incorrect value will result in the numeric data be improperly interpreted when constructing the primitive numeric value.
        Parameters:
        order -
        Returns:
        this ByteArray

      • getOrder

        public ByteOrder getOrder()
        This returns the byte order to be used in setting and getting binary numeric data from the byte array.
        Returns:
        order

      • getBuffer

        public ByteBuffer getBuffer()
        This returns a new ByteBuffer with the same backing array used by this object. The returned ByteBuffer is reset so that the position is set to zero, the limit is set to the capacity and any mark is discarded.
        Returns:
        the underlying ByteBuffer
